commit.message:
Merge pull request #61 from Paczesiowa/master

optimize normalization - slight change in output (epsilon ~e-18), about 30x speedup on relevant code.
optimize normalization
suppress OSError on trying to delete intermediates that have already been deleted
rewrite entropy calculation to avoid FutureWarning on nansum
version bump to 1.1.6
make nb_numfeats an int, fixes #46, thanks to @remibolcom
remove broken link to homepage from readme

Merge pull request #41 from tripleee/master

langid.py: Fix for issue #29
make readme consistent with default behaviour with respect to probability normalization

langid.py: Fix for issue #29

When classifying a line at a time, only read a line at a time, so as to
prevent Python from loading a large file into memory needlessly.

Merge pull request #39 from jnothman/one-line-tweets

One-per-line output is now true where tweet contains newline
One-per-line output is now true where tweet contains newline

Merge pull request #38 from jnothman/norm_tweets

Include some Tweet normalisation
Include some Tweet normalisation
remove dev tag, version bump to 1.1.5

Merge pull request #37 from pquentin/classifiers

Add PyPI classifiers

Add PyPI classifiers

Fixes #34

Merge pull request #32 from martinth/master

Fixes ImportError on Python 3.

Fixes ImportError on Python 3.

Without this relative import Python 3 will try to import 'classify', etc. from
the langid module (instead of the langid.py file) because absolute imports
are now a default.
made langid.py cross-compatible with Python2 and Python3
removed unnecessary import
added a list of the 7480-feature model that is built into langid.py
added an option to printfeats to show the feature directly rather than a repr of the feature
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/saffsd/langid.py
added word n-gram tokenization
fixed a wrong variable reference
added utility to print features by weight
fixed error in indexing
fixed an error in how labels were being ordered
cosmetic changes to how output is done
